title: Neonatal Partial Exchange for Polycythemia
desc: The Neonatal Partial Exchange for Polycythemia estimates the volume of whole blood to remove and volume of crystalloid to infuse in neonatal polycythemia.

orgreference.text: Black VD, Rumack CM, Lubchenco LO, Koops BL. Gastrointestinal injury in polycythemic term infants. Pediatrics. 1985;76(2):225-31.

data.evidence:
Volume of replacement fluid = [ blood volume, mL × (Hct(actual) - Hct(goal)) ] / Hct(actual)

Where blood volume = 100 mL/kg if preterm and 85 mL/kg if term.

Example calculation:

  • Patient blood volume = 200 mL, Hct(actual) = 70, Hct(goal) = 60
  • (200 mL × (0.7 – 0.6)) / 0.7
  • Replacement volume is 29 mL (remove 29 mL whole blood, replace 29 mL crystalloid)
